column5: Hey can anyone tell me if you can use roe at whitemans?  Thanks Adam

Read the regs (it's on page 6 of this pdf)  http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/stdprodconsume/groups/lr/@mnr/@letsfish/documents/document/mnr_e001335.pdf  Looks like the short answer is that it depends where you're fishing, which doesn't necessarily mean you can get access to the bits where it's allowed
I did read the regs and I called the MNR just to see and the girl I talked to all she said was maybe :s it dont say you can't use roe:s and some ppl say you can and some say you can't so I don't know
If you're between Robinson Road and Cleaver Sideroad the short answer is NO!
Ok that's all I needed to know thanks

The regs say "Whitemans Creek : between Robinson Road and Cleaver Sideroad : Only artificial lures may be used." Roe is not an artificial lure so you can't use it there, otherwise you're OK. It's really not that difficult
Another question, on the sign going down to the creek it also says no organic bait would Gulp Alive be considered organic bait?
